intro: Selenocarpaea peltaria, commonly known as the silverleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white wax, giving it a silvery appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in complex inflorescences, typically appearing in late spring. Selenocarpaea peltaria is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert regions.
